msgSnippet: If the _parent_ s setUp is executed and not the child s, you are probably not overriding the method correctly. What happens often: public void setup(){... ^

If the _parent_ 's setUp is executed and not the child's, you are probably
not overriding the method correctly. What happens often:
 public void setup(){...
                ^
instead of:
 public void setUp(){...
                ^
> -----Original Message-----
> From: parul_49 [mailto:parul_49@...]
> Sent: vrijdag 19 juli 2002 0:12
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Setup inheritance
> 
> 
> Hi,
> I have a question regarding the running to the setup methods.
> 
> I have a parent class that extends the TestCase.
> All my other testClasses extend this parent class.
> 
> I have a setup in the parent and a setup in the child classes.
> 
> I have however seen that the parent's setup is executed, however the 
> child setup is never executed.
> 
> The parent setup throws 2 exceptions and the child classes setup does 
> not throw any. I dont know if this is the reason, but I cant seem to 
> get the child classes setup rbe executed.
> Any ideas?
> 
> 
>

subject: RE: [junit] Setup inheritance
